meanings.definition: The state of being bound or restricted.
meanings.sent1: The boundness of the rope kept the dog from running too far.
meanings.sent2: The boundness of the fence limited the sheep's movement.
meanings.sent3: The boundness of the maze made the mouse rethink its strategy.
meanings.sent4: The boundness of the contract ensured both parties followed the agreement.
meanings.sent5: The boundness of the handcuffs made escape impossible.

meanings.definition: The quality of being certain or destined to happen.
meanings.sent1: The boundness of the sunrise brought a sense of comfort to the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The boundness of the seasons changing reassured the farmers of a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The boundness of the prediction made everyone excited for the upcoming event.
meanings.sent4: The boundness of fate guided their paths to cross at the right moment.
meanings.sent5: The boundness of time passing reminded them of the fleeting nature of life.
